paperTitle: Enhancing the Merger Simulation Toolkit with ML/AI

candidates.title: Identification in Differentiated Products Markets Using Market Level Data
candidates.reason: Core theoretical foundation: the paper explicitly builds its flexible supply identification on Berry–Haile (2014), repeatedly leveraging their assumptions and results and contrasting its Theorem 3.1 to BH’s Section 4.4.

candidates.title: Evaluating the Performance of Merger Simulation: Evidence from the U.S. Airline Industry*
candidates.reason: Central empirical motivation and application template: highlights limits of standard conduct assumptions, informs overlap-market definitions, and serves as the primary retrospective benchmark in airlines.

candidates.title: Best practices for differentiated products demand estimation with PyBLP
candidates.reason: Instrumental for Monte Carlo design and implementation: pyblp is used to generate data across many markets and to operationalize the standard toolkit used as the main comparator.

candidates.title: Automobile Prices in Market Equilibrium
candidates.reason: Foundational demand framework and instrumentation for merger simulation; the paper’s demand setup, moments, and instruments directly follow BLP.

candidates.title: Fixed-Point Approaches to Computing Bertrand-Nash Equilibrium Prices Under Mixed-Logit Demand
candidates.reason: Provides the contraction mapping used to implement the standard merger simulation baseline against which the ML/AI method is evaluated.

candidates.title: The Effects of Mergers in Differentiated Products Industries: Logit Demand and Merger Policy
candidates.reason: Frames the traditional merger-simulation workflow (demand plus assumed conduct) that the paper aims to relax and improve upon.

candidates.title: Mergers with differentiated products: the case of the ready-to-eat cereal industry
candidates.reason: Canonical implementation of merger simulation (demand elasticities + conduct) that underpins the benchmark the new method enhances.

candidates.title: Estimating Discrete-Choice Models of Product Differentiation
candidates.reason: Supplies the Berry inversion and logit structure used for demand-side derivations and moments referenced by the toolkit.

candidates.title: Deep learning for individual heterogeneity: an automatic inference framework
candidates.reason: Provides econometric justification for integrating deep learning into two-stage structural estimation with interpretability—key to the ML/AI approach.

candidates.title: Extremum estimation and numerical derivatives
candidates.reason: Supplies the numerical delta method and numerical differentiation tools used for inference on the estimated supply function.

candidates.title: Unconstrained Monotonic Neural Networks
candidates.reason: Supports the paper’s shape-restricted network design to enforce monotonicity (e.g., sign of derivatives) in the learned supply function.

candidates.title: Deep Lattice Networks and Partial Monotonic Functions
candidates.reason: Provides an alternative architecture for imposing monotonic constraints central to the paper’s economically interpretable supply learning.

candidates.title: Monotonic Networks
candidates.reason: Foundational reference for monotone neural networks underpinning the paper’s discussion and implementation of monotonicity constraints.

candidates.title: Minimax Estimation of Conditional Moment Models
candidates.reason: Methodological basis for minimax/adversarial estimation of conditional moments closely related to the VMM approach the paper adapts.

candidates.title: Adversarial Generalized Method of Moments
candidates.reason: Closely related adversarial/GMM framework informing the paper’s modern moment-based estimation strategy.

candidates.title: An Adversarial Approach to Structural Estimation
candidates.reason: Provides adversarial structural estimation insights and efficiency benchmarks relevant to the paper’s ML/GMM-style estimation.

candidates.title: Provably Efficient Neural Estimation of Structural Equation Model: An Adversarial Approach
candidates.reason: Adds to the theoretical underpinnings for neural/adversarial estimation in structural settings.

candidates.title: Instrumental variable regression via kernel maximum moment loss
candidates.reason: Related advances in moment-based/IV estimation that support the paper’s estimation philosophy.

candidates.title: Market counterfactuals and the specification of multiproduct demand: A nonparametric approach
candidates.reason: Conceptual precedent for nonparametric structure in IO; the paper analogously develops a nonparametric supply-side approach.

candidates.title: Does Multimarket Contact Facilitate Tacit Collusion? Inference on Conduct Parameters in the Airline Industry
candidates.reason: Empirical evidence of non-competitive conduct in airlines motivating the paper’s relaxation of standard conduct assumptions.

candidates.title: The Price Effects of a Large Merger of Manufacturers: A Case Study of Maytag-Whirlpool
candidates.reason: Serves as a reduced-form merger-effects benchmark informing the retrospective evaluation strategy.

candidates.title: Simulating the Dynamic Effects of Horizontal Mergers: U.S. Airlines
candidates.reason: Provides dynamic-merger context and methods that the paper contrasts with its (primarily static) ML/AI approach.

candidates.title: The Welfare Effects of Dynamic Pricing: Evidence from Airline Markets
candidates.reason: Background on dynamic pricing in airlines underpinning the application context and the need for flexible conduct modeling.

candidates.title: Repositioning and market power after airline mergers
candidates.reason: Background on post-merger network/pricing adjustments relevant to interpreting airline merger counterfactuals.

candidates.title: Market Structure and Competition in Airline Markets
candidates.reason: Industry background on competition crucial for application framing but less central to the method.

candidates.title: Price Discrimination in International Airline Markets
candidates.reason: Contextual background on pricing behavior in airlines; supports application narrative.

candidates.title: Airline Hubs: Costs
candidates.reason: Markups and the Implications of Customer Heterogeneity, Industry background on costs/markups and heterogeneity; tangential to the core methodological contribution.

candidates.title: Estimation of a Model of Entry in the Airline Industry
candidates.reason: Early airline IO reference setting broader industry context rather than informing the new method directly.

candidates.title: Anticompetitive Effects of Common Ownership
candidates.reason: Used for market definition (city-pair) conventions; peripheral to the main methodology.

candidates.title: The Competitive Effects of Common Ownership: Economic Foundations and Empirical Evidence
candidates.reason: As above, informs market definition and context; limited direct impact on modeling or estimation.

candidates.title: Some Applications and Limitations of Recent Advances in Empirical Industrial Organization: Merger Analysis
candidates.reason: Broad perspective on merger analysis used for positioning; minimal direct methodological influence.

candidates.title: Chapter 76 Large Sample Sieve Estimation of Semi-Nonparametric Models
candidates.reason: General NPIV/semi-nonparametric background signaling flexibility; not directly implemented here.

candidates.title: Linear Inverse Problems in Structural Econometrics Estimation Based on Spectral Decomposition and Regularization
candidates.reason: Additional NPIV/regularization background; peripheral to the VMM-based estimation used.

candidates.title: A Simple Sequentially Rejective Multiple Test Procedure
candidates.reason: Used only to adapt Holm’s step-down procedure for simultaneous confidence intervals; ancillary to the core contribution.
